intro: Gilia rigidula subsp. eurigidula, commonly known as the rigid gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The species is known for its resilience to drought and its role in supporting local pollinators.
